text: Neela () is a 2001 Indian Kannada drama film directed by T. S. Nagabharana and written by Kotiganahalli Ramayya. Featuring Gayatri Jayaraman in the lead protagonist role, it also stars Ananth Nag, Shivadhwaj, Jayanthi and Naveen Mayur in key roles. The story is about a nomadic folk singer, Neela, who belongs to the "Neelagararu" tribe. She develops throat cancer and suddenly loses her voice. The story highlights her struggle to survive in her conservative society. Neela was screened at the Indian Panorama international festival and won many accolades for the content.Neela is a bridge film The film won the third best film at the Karnataka State Film Awards and Gayatri Jayaraman won Best Actress Cinema Express Awards. == Cast == * Gayatri Jayaraman as Neela * Shivadhwaj as Sanjeeva * Ananth Nag as Shivajja * Sarath Babu as Palegar Jagadevaraya * Jayanthi as Jagadevaraya's Mother * Rangayana Raghu as Siddayya * Naveen Mayur as Karthik * Enagi Nataraj as History Professor * Apoorva Bargur as Geethanjali ==Soundtrack== The music was composed by the renowned composer Vijaya Bhaskar, his last work before his death.Music Director Vijayabhaskar dead The soundtrack consisted of 12 tracks most of which were sung by acclaimed playback singer Vani Jairam. == References == == External links == * Neela songs at MIO * Category:2001 films Category:Indian films Category:2000s Kannada-language films Category:Kannada film scores by Vijaya Bhaskar
